column4: Spits out this error whenever I attempt an update or install a package.Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)
They appear to be
I've run apt-get update
And run apt-get autoremove
that shows some packages that can be removed yet it wont uninstall/install anything
If I use synaptec, it gives me the same error in the console window
Funny thing is it references Hotplug yet says its not installed when I try to remove
Here is the c/v of the error

dpkg: parse error, in file `/var/lib/dpkg/available' near line 1685 package `module-init-tools': `Replaces' field, reference to `hotplug': version contains `)'E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)
Because of that, it seems I can't install anything.
try  sudo dpkg --reconfigure -a
error - dpkg: conflicting actions -e (--control) and -r (--remove)
first console said dpkg: conflicting actions -e (--control) and -r (--remove)
oops...sorry it said dpkg: unknown option --reconfigure
sems type    --reconfigure                  2 --
typo

Help doesn't show a reconfigure but a configure so I used that instead, and it gave me this output: dpkg: parse error, in file `/var/lib/dpkg/available' near line 1685 package `module-init-tools': `Replaces' field, reference to `hotplug': version contains `)'
ShanB   sudo dpkg --reconfigure -a
k lemme try that
still gives me this: dpkg: unknown option --reconfigure
very sory its          sudo dpkg-reconfigure -a
